blurb: The flexible card game for everyone, with 1-6 players and 3 levels of difficulty, that will twist your mind and test friendships.
description: The flexible card game for everyone, with 1-6 players and 3 levels of difficulty, that will twist your mind and test friendships.
name: Twist - A flexible card game for everyone (even babies)
title: Twist - A flexible card game for everyone (even babies)
Title: Twist - A flexible card game for everyone (even babies)
Description: The flexible card game for everyone, with 1-6 players and 3 levels of difficulty, that will twist your mind and test friendships.
Link: Twist - A flexible card game for everyone (even babies)The flexible card game for everyone, with 1-6 players and 3 levels of difficulty, that will twist your mind and test friendships.
description_story:
Story







The aim of creating this game was multifold. As a fan of tabletop games, I wanted something that I could play with friends and get drunk. As a parent, I wanted something that would be educational, as well as entertaining for impatient kids to get away from screens. As a man who likes to hide in my cave, it is something I can play alone. So I created a flexible card game suitable for many occasions and age groups.









Think about this - How much do you spend on entertainment outside? A typical trip to a shopping centre will cost around 50 to 60 dollars, depending on what you do. That is the typical cost of 2 movie tickets, popcorn and a cheap meal for two.
As for kids, each activity or enrichment course costs around 130 dollars a month. Art class, martial arts, sports, programming, it all adds up easily to a few hundred dollars a month. Time with kids away from their screens and addiction? Priceless.









For only 60 Singapore dollars, you get to have a deck of Twist cards that can be played during gatherings, as well as for family fun. All rewards come with free global shipping. I'm not making much money per deck. It was done to share the joy of playing card games with the rest of the world. Instead of a few hours of entertainment outside, or 2 piano classes, you get many hours of fun with Twist!
As it was designed for the brainy ones, every player has to Twist their mind somehow to win! For those who are not so smart, you can win too! In fact, my 8 year old kid has figured out how to win me without stretching his mind too much! Also, he gets to be creative by playing with me!









90 unique cards, 3 levels, and many ways to play. Comes with instructions for recommended gameplay based on computer optimization. I ran many simulations to make sure it was difficult to win.

















Twist is a flexible card game, designed for many different occasions. It can even be used to educate your 2 year old! There are 3 difficulty levels and multiple game modes available, all in one deck, for up to 6 players! If you are more of a caveman like I am, there is even a single player mode available, where you can lose to dumb luck! Imagine that.
The exciting part is when you play with a group of friends. Punishment: Drink beer, or do some pushups, or whatever twisted punishment you can come up with. Twist is one game where you can sabotage one another, gang up, and turn the tables with certain cards! No one knows the outcome until the end. Even the smartest person in the room can lose if you know how it works. You can be a kamikaze player, and no one wins!









If you play with kids, adjust the difficulty level accordingly and let the kids challenge their personal limits by playing! Not only will it train kids to push their personal limit, it is a game where the imagination is the only limit! I've had lots of fun playing with my 8 year old. He won the intermediate level by knowing how to game the system. He won by a razor thin margin on the hardest level. If you want your kids to be away from electronic devices and train their minds to be sharp and fast, play Twist.
For 2 year olds, there is a special way to play. As long as the kid doesn't eat up the cards, of course.
What is special about Twist? The rules are not set in stone. It is up to your Twisted mind to imagine which rules rule.
Here is a brief video of the gameplay.







You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play


































Replay with sound









Play with 
 sound












00:00


00:00










































Early birds can buy a single deck for S$55 (only 100 available). You can also buy two decks for only S$100, to share with another friend. Only 50 sets available. For the rest, S$60 per deck. I'm not making huge profits per deck, and I chose a reliable supplier to ensure that you get the cards as soon as possible. To ensure you get good quality products, I made a sample deck at very high cost, just to check.

















Stretch goal - reach S$30,000 and instead of the normal deck, everyone gets a collectors' edition deck. I will include some modifications to the game to empower the weak minds to win! Only on Kickstarter. I will also modify the box so that you can brag about the limited edition Twist. After this campaign, I will only produce the normal deck.









Don't hesitate, support my campaign! It will be fun, for a very low price!









I'm a typical Asian parent, as well as a designer, educator, engineer, scientist and gamer. As geeky as it gets.
description_risks:
I used a reputable manufacturer to make these cards. You can rest assure that the quality will be good, as I have made a sample deck for myself, at very high cost.

To ensure that you receive these cards as soon as possible, I decided to make less profits per deck. It should take around 1 to 2 months to reach you (maximum expected time should be 3 months).

There are contingency plans such as alternative suppliers.

I've also spent the last month testing this game with other people, to ensure that you have the most fun!

blurb: A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Monthly Planner. Fully waterproof to withstand spills!
description: A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Monthly Planner. Fully waterproof to withstand spills!
name: Timeless Journals - A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Planner.
title: Timeless Journals - A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Planner.
Title: Timeless Journals - A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Planner.
Description: A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Monthly Planner. Fully waterproof to withstand spills!
Link: Timeless Journals - A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Planner.A Premium, Undated Stone Paper Monthly Planner. Fully waterproof to withstand spills!
description_story:
Story







Remember buying a planner in 2018, but it's almost 2019 and you haven't used it? 




We never expire.





The Timeless Journal is a premium, undated monthly stone paper planner suitable for the generations to come. We don’t restrict you to a certain calendar year, so you can use it anytime, anywhere and how ever you want–it’s all up to you. You’ll never have to wait for January to begin a new journal.   Made with Stone Paper, Timeless Journals is waterproof, tear-resistant and thus, ultra durable. Using stone waste from mining industries, and zero water or wood, our paper is environmentally friendly, silky soft and paper-cut proof. 







Timeless Journals will never discolour, disintegrate or crumble with time. Whether you stop halfway or keep your journal in a collection, your Timeless Journal will look exactly the way you left it.















                                                  















We designed Timeless Journals to revolutionize the way people use, style and keep their planners. In our research, we discovered Stone Paper, an alternative to regular paper. Stone paper is waterproof, paper-cut proof, fire-retardant, tear proof and generally lasts way longer than regular paper. This was in line with our goal of creating a journal that was longer lasting, and sturdy enough to resist tears or water spills.Also, stone paper uses no wood or water during production, unlike regular paper! This results in grainless paper that is oh, so smooth.
 


















Yes, that's us washing the book.








12 undated monthly spreads. No restrictions - you’ll never have to wait for January to start a journal again.








Also,  large boxes that maximize your journal’s space and potential while maintaining a professional and clean design.








Dot grids with 5 mm spacing, providing writing, sketching or drawing guidance without the distraction from lined or grid pages.
















Most importantly, Timeless Journals are waterproof! Don’t worry about spilling your drinks or writing with wet hands because your journal is absolutely WATERPROOF! WORKS WITH WATER AND OTHER COLOURED LIQUIDS!








2 waterproof and tear-proof stone paper pockets to keep all your loose sheets, stickers, notes or photos.








Self-healing PU leather that is scratch-resistant and waterproof, along with a reinforced elastic band that is longer lasting.








Lay flat binding








Handy A5 size to bring out on your daily commutes





























Timeless Journals are suitable for everyone! 

A working professional who simply needs a space to note his schedule and write meeting notes or to do lists.
 
A student who only needs to organize their schedule during the academic months and pen down notes and mind-maps during lessons. 
 
A traveller or backpacker who needs a planner that's sturdier, durable and weatherproof!
 
An artist who pens down his ideas and drawings on the go. 
 
A parent who wants to record her journey as a parent, or even simply, use it as a personal cookbook!
 
A budding entrepreneur who needs to keep track of his accounts, and manage an ever so packed schedule.
 
As a gift during anytime of the year.

and most importantly, YOU!

 









With undated months and dot grid pages, Timeless Journals are extremely versatile. Draw, scrapbook, create your layouts or work with none, it’s all up to you.

 We give you the essentials, you create.








As a thank you to all our Kickstarter backers, we are offering not one, but TWO exclusive features for you guys!


Timeless Journals come in Timeless Black, and a Kickstarter Exclusive Twinkle Pink!













Also, customize your Timeless Journal!









We are providing customized gold foil text for every backer! You can choose to have your name, initials, favourite word, special dates or even your company name! (Up to 10 characters).































Timeless Journals uses no trees or water in production, and we want to take it a step further. As such, we pledge to plant one tree for every Timeless Journal purchased. Each tree planted helps to make our planet a better place. We have chosen One Tree Planted, in their quest in reforestation in North America, Latin America, Asia and Africa. 


We will be focusing on reforestation in Indonesia, where deforestation and developments have reduced the habitats of wildlife. In Indonesia, jungles are still being illegally logged daily to make room for palm oil, rubber and paper plantations. Each tree planted helps to reforest the country and protect the wildlife. Every little bit goes a long way in reforestation.
description_risks:
Every Kickstarter campaign comes with its own risks and challenges. Despite all the preparation and planning we have done, we cannot ensure that there will be no risks or unforeseen challenges. However, here is what we are prepared for.

1. Production Delays
To avoid delays in manufacturing and production, we have a shorter campaign period, allowing us to collect the surveys and send the items for production right on schedule. Also, once our campaign is backed, we have intentions to proceed with the production of the inner sheets to speed up the manufacturing process. 

2. Customization
Should there be any issues in customization errors, we have backup debossing suppliers that we are able to work with. Nevertheless, to minimize the possibility of such errors, we have set up systems and processes with our manufacturer to ensure that this is a foolproof method.

3. Quality Control
To ensure that your Timeless Journal is of the highest quality, we will be checking every single product before dispatching it out. We will be hiring additional people and activating our friends and family to help us out in doing quality checks and highlighting any potential issues to prevent a delay on dispatch. 

4. Unforeseen Challenges
We’ve heard of horror stories where a creator goes MIA after a campaign is backed. We don’t want to be like that. Follow us on both Instagram and Facebook, where we’ll post regular updates on the progress, and also share behind the scenes videos and photos on production and packing! We will always be contactable at hello@timelessjournals.com as well.

Story

description_risks:
We are a confident team who are ready to confront any situation that may occur. We work with suppliers and manufacturers who have been in the industry for more than decade and are well prepared to produce in large quantities.

While there are are always risks and challenges involved in creating new products, we minimized them by having the entire process from production to delivery arranged. 

Certain issues like delay in worldwide shipment due to customs regulations are not under our control but our dedicated team will be ready to assist as much as possible and make the process as smooth as we can.

We are glad to have you on this journey with us and we will do everything we can to keep you satisfied every step of the way.

Thanks for making this possible for us!

ESKI.

blurb: Meaningful Interactions & Resource Sharing Near You
description: Meaningful Interactions & Resource Sharing Near You
name: Scratchbac: The Proximity-based Social App
title: Scratchbac: The Proximity-based Social App
Title: Scratchbac: The Proximity-based Favour App
Description: Meaningful Interactions & Resource Sharing Near You
Link: Scratchbac: The Proximity-based Favour AppMeaningful Interactions & Resource Sharing Near You
description_story:
Story

What is Scratchbac?
Scratchbac helps you connect easily with people physically around you to enable meaningful interactions and resource sharing.









Scratchbac started as a Telegram bot to bring people closer amidst the isolating pandemic. Over the past year, 60,000 users have joined Scratchbac and the impact created by the community has blown us away:
> 50,000 meaningful interactions were enabled. 10,000 items were given away. 22 lost pets were found and 1 suicide was prevented.
However, to provide a safe and impact-focused experience for our users, we must move beyond the technical limitations of Telegram and build our own app. But we've reached a point where the ongoing cost of operation and development is no longer sustainable. 
We're almost there but need your help.
The development of the app will tie up our whole team for the next few months. If we meet the Kickstarter goal, we can hire additional developers to help with code reviews and get interns to help maintain the bot. Simultaneously, the core team can focus on making the dream app safe, secure and robust. If we go beyond the goal, we can go further and build more exciting features!

Why Build a Different Social App?
We realised we hardly know the people in our communities.









Technology connects us to anyone anywhere in the world, yet we know nothing about the people around us. We're alone in our neighbourhoods filled with strangers and closed doors.


In fact, there was no easy way to get in touch with the people and activities around us.









We tried to join dozens of social media groups to interact with people in our area. But often those exchanges were merely transactional. We wanted a platform that could help us meaningfully connect with others nearby.


Hence, we're creating a safe space for everyone to form true connections.









We want to take away the pressures of “views” and “likes” on social media and let you genuinely connect with people around you. Our goal is to create a positive social platform where people can engage, collaborate, and help one another easily.

Check out Scratchbac's features:
1. Keep up with the hyperlocal happenings on your Live Location Feed




Posts from around your real-time location








E.g. Jeanette reuniting a lost toy and its owner





2. Keep track of what's important all the time in your Home and Work Feed




Posts from around your Home/ Work








E.g. Colin sharing his bakes with neighbours







3. Interact meaningfully with Comments or Chat




Comment publicly or chat personally








E.g. Archanna collating group buy orders via chat













Rewards
Scratchbac Premium









Enhanced features designed specifically to help our loyal supporters experience the most out of Scratchbac. (Find out more about SB Coins in the Sustainability section below!)











SB Badges




Exclusive badges for our Kickstarter backers to add to their in-app profiles.  (Links to credits page with your names!)







SB Stickers 




Exclusive die-cut 10pc vinyl sticker set 







SB T-Shirt (See Environmental Commitments at bottom of the page!)




Exclusive white cotton T-shirt with the SB hand and brand embroidered in jet black. 







SB Bucket Hat




Exclusive white bucket hat with the SB hand embroidered in jet black.







SB Cap






Exclusive white cap with the SB hand embroidered in jet black. 













How do we plan to be sustainable long term?
Scratchbac Coins
A paid coins system will be our primary source of income. They can be used in 2 ways to improve your Scratchbac experience:


1. Scratchbac Virtual Items 









Virtual Items are digital objects used in Scratchbac for users to commend one another or to recognise certain milestones. These items let you express your creativity, establish credibility, and are a symbol of your achievements. They will be displayed on your posts and can also be found in your profiles.


2. Scratchbac Post Add-Ons









To help you spruce up their posts and reach your people more effectively, you can use coins to add URLs or Commercial Features to your posts.

















Timeline
End of November 2021: Our Kickstarter campaign begins!
End December 2021: Our Kickstarter campaign concludes. 
Mid-January 2022: Beta App Is ready for Kickstarter Backer Early Access. We will use this opportunity to improve our platform based on your feedback.
Mid-Late February 2022: Scratchbac Phase I App now available on Android and Apple! Features include Live, Home and Work Location Feeds, Comment, Chat, Coins and Items!
March 2022: We will begin fulfilling our physical rewards such as T-shirts, Hats, Caps and Stickers.
May 2022: With our Kickstarter funding, we will develop and release our Scratchbac Phase II App with the Premium features.
Q3 2022 Onwards: Launch of Phase III & Gear Up for Global Release.

 Our Commitment to You:









1. Your Privacy is our Priority
No other users can direct message you privately unless both of you are connected. Non-connected users can only Chat with you through your post and you are in control of who can reach out to you.


2. Nobody will ever know your exact location
Your location data never leaves your phone. We obscure your position in Geo-hashed data that represents an area instead of a specific point. In other words, you can never be tracked on Scratchbac while still enjoying the proximity services!


3. We will never sell your data
Your personal data is yours to keep. Scratchbac will never sell your data to third parties. You are our customers, not our products and we are here to serve you.









 Our Team  




From left to right: Ryan, Cheryl, Bala, Princeton and Jerry.





Our humble team started as a group of unlikely friends who met in university (SUTD whoo!).  Between the 5 of us, we've worked on countless projects. From hardware to software, if you can name it we can probably build it (please don't say nuclear power plant...).
Jerry Neo,Team Lead
Jerry is crazy about smart city tech and the environment. In his free time,  he practises Muaythai and coaches his varsity team occasionally.  His background is in entrepreneurship, computer eng and renewable tech. 
Fun fact: Designed an Automated Letterbox System for the Smart Cities of tomorrow. 
Cheryl Low, UIUX & Marketing
Cheryl is passionate about user-centric design and tech. In her free time, she volunteers at TechforShe, mentoring and helping to facilitate workshops. Her background is in design science and mechanical eng. 
Fun fact: Designed Tello! a communication tool for those with lock-in syndrome that won the Startup Weekend 2019.
Princeton Poh, DevOps & Front-end
Princeton is enthusiastic about Human Behaviour and Social Integration. He is our unofficial "Chief Morality Officer". Currently, he is completing his masters in computer science and tech entrepreneurship at SUTD as a scholar. 
Fun fact: Wrote the first lines of code for Scratchbac and the OG Telegram Bot.
Vivkebala, System Architect & Back-end
Bala is a modern-day farmer, interested in Urban Farming and Education. In his free time, he cultivates mushrooms at home with the hope of creating decentralised farms in the future. Currently, he is completing his masters in computer science and tech entrepreneurship at SUTD as a scholar.
Fun fact: Helped to develop the Singapore National Day Parade Online Ticketing System in 2019.
Ryan Yip, Front-end & Data Analytics
Ryan is all about front-end development these days. He loves to bring life to UI designs through code even though he is also darn good at data analytics. His background is in business analytics & operations research, machine learning and AI.
Fun fact: He was president of the SUTD Muaythai club and he's even better than Jerry.

Features
Click to view the features in full:









































































Ready-to-back?









1. Click "Back this project"
2. Select a Reward and "Pledge"
3. When the campaign is successful and closes, we will get to fulfilling your rewards!









Media
Feel free to reach out to us at info@scratchbac.com and make full use of our Media Kit.

blurb: Iconic Singaporean shophouses that whistle. Potter Andrew handcrafted these historical architecture. Support him today!
description: Iconic Singaporean shophouses that whistle. Potter Andrew handcrafted these historical architecture. Support him today!
name: Whistling Shophouses | Previously on MAKE100
title: Whistling Shophouses | Previously on MAKE100
Title: Whistling Shophouses | Previously on MAKE100
Description: Iconic Singaporean shophouses that whistle. Potter Andrew handcrafted these historical architecture. Support him today!
Link: Whistling Shophouses | Previously on MAKE100Iconic Singaporean shophouses that whistle. Potter Andrew handcrafted these historical architecture. Support him today!
description_story:
StoryOn a Sunday morning I received a WhatsApp message from Andrew. He sent me this picture and said in Chinese, "These little houses just got out of the kiln." 




Andrew sent me this on WhatsApp





It has been almost a year since we first did MAKE100 with the cute Owl-carinas, and Andrew was very delighted with the support. After the first kickstarter project in 2020, we briefly discussed about this year's MAKE100, and how he wants to launch more kickstarters to share his work with the world. Although I am helping him with these campaigns, it struck me one day that I do not really know his story . 
This campaign marks the start of a series of Andrew's life as a potter in Singapore, a beautiful journey about one who chose to pursue art in a city at a time where it was, and still is, difficult making a living out of art.  
*Note: Scroll down to 'About the Project' for the rewards. 


part 1 - THE WEDGE
Clay has to be wedged carefully to remove air pockets that might be trapped, and to ensure that the clay is uniform before a potter starts. Not consistent and you face problems moulding it. Too many air pockets and it explodes in the kiln. The fate of a finished piece is decided much earlier on...
Andrew was one of my instructors when I was an apprentice at Boon's Pottery (Mr Boon, a master potter and the owner of the studio, allowed me to learn from the instructors for free while I was struggling with my startup life in 2019. A story for another time!) As we both live in the west side of Singapore, we would take the same bus back after lessons. I would bombard him with questions on pottery techniques and sometimes he would share interesting snippets of his past. One day, he told me to go over to his place to take a look at his collection, and that was how the first MAKE100 campaign started. For this first interview, he was playing 'Angry Birds' on his computer when I got there :)









Andrew: "I was born in Singapore in 1949, but just 40 days after I was born, my family relocated to Indonesia because my father had a business there. Since we also had family in Singapore, we would come back to Singapore a few times each year for visiting. I was lucky to be born with a silver spoon in my mouth because of my family's thriving business, and I basically got whatever I wanted as a kid. My parents bought a piano and violin for me when I was just 6, however, I had zero interest in music although my third brother was very musically inclined. 




Andrew with his parents and brother. He is on the far left.





We lived in a nice house along the river, and big boats sailed along daily. I would sketch and paint the scenery, and I was only 7 when I started. I could also recall that my love for art started at a young age. I would sketch actors and celebrities on the print commercials and was passionate to pursue commercial arts when I grow older. My parents dissuaded me because they see no value in art, and partly because all they knew at that point was that artists and designers have to scale heights to paint malls and buildings. 
While my childhood was pretty comfortable, things took a bad turn in the 60s. Due to political unrest and conflicts, my school was shut down. It was unsafe, and my grandfather had to bring me back to Singapore in 1963 and to live together with my grandmother. Although I had to relocate, life was still comfortable. My pocket money was $5,  which was a lot at the time because one bowl of noodles was only around 30 cents. During Chinese New Year, I also received lots of red packets from my father's business associates. 
One happy memory was an adventure with my friends back in the early 60s, when I was just 14 years old.  It was before Singapore's independence, and one of my relatives told us that it was the harvest season for one of the fruit farms they owned in Pontian Kechil, Malaysia. I gathered 6 of my friends, and we brought our identity cards and some allowances, then made our way to the fruit farm. Back then laws were lax so we could travel to Malaysia without a passport. We didn't know the way, so we asked around as we went about. We took buses after buses and finally arrived at the farm. We had a great time traveling and exploring, and we even caught a show in Johor Bahru, Malaysia before making our way back to Singapore. 




Andrew as a young boy having fun





I received a bad piece of news one morning in 1966 and my life turned upside down. My grandfather told me that my father passed away due to leukemia. He was just in his 40s. I was devastated emotionally, but there were more problems. My dad was the sole breadwinner, so with no financial support, my grandfather couldn't afford rent and we had to shift around a couple of times. We ended up living together with 2 aunts. 
Life was tough without much income, and we had to resort to eating leftovers from hawker centres at times. To supplement my household income, I would do whatever job I could find while schooling. I helped a photography studio to develop photographs at 2 cents per photograph, and I remember setting up a small shop to sell handmade keychain and jewellery to make ends meet.
In 1970, when I finished secondary school, my family was too poor to afford high school. Without a high school education, I could not go to university. I thought my future was bleak, so all I had in mind was to start working as soon as possible to put food on the table for my family. However, with no skills or qualifications, I could go nowhere. My cousin was then a shell craft instructor at the Baharuddin Vocational Institute, and recommended the school to me. The Baharuddin Vocational Institute aimed to nurture skilled designers and craftsmen, and he told me to join the 9-month long rosewood furniture making course so that I will be able to start work after I graduate as a carpenter. 
The admission test required applicants to carve an elephant and a pencil holder out of a block of wood. I did well, and the teacher was curious on how I did it and so I explained my process to him. I then got accepted into the course. We learned to build furniture with rosewood and learned to join wood using joints, without any screws or fasteners. In the rosewood furniture workshop, there were 'No Smoking' signs all over because the wood and sawdust are flammable. The teacher and his assistant would always remind us not to smoke in the workshop, but they would sit with their feet up the desk and smoked as they taught the class. We were pissed off because they were not leading by example and it was dangerous. We were young and cheeky at that age, so one day, we ganged up to all smoke together in class with our feet up our desk. The teacher was furious, and he grabbed the smallest guy and threatened to punch him. The few of us stood around him (I was one of the tallest guys there) and dared him to try, and in the end he stomped out of the class. 
After 9 months of training, the rosewood company offered a coffee table making job at $5-8/hour at 10 hours a day, but we had to purchase our own tools. That wasn't very attractive at that point in time, so I decided to stay in school and applied to the interior design course with my course-mate, who was also my neighbour. However, after the smoking incident, the rosewood furniture teacher was transferred to the interior design course. He rejected our applications. My neighbour went to speak to the principal, so he ended up joining the course, but I didn't. The interior design industry was booming after our graduation, and my neighbour became a very wealthy man running his own company. 
That rejection hit hard, but it was also the reason why I took up the pottery course. I picked up my fundamentals from those classes. At that point I didn't think I was going to be a full time potter, but I knew that I really enjoy creating things and seeing my creations come to life. I picked up hand-building (slab work, coiling, pinch, sculpting) and wheel-throwing, and experimented with different forms and glazes. My wife-to-be was a good thrower in my class, and we would both be chosen for commissioned production work whenever there was one. At that very same time period, I was picking up shell-craft from my cousin, and we would go to the beach and skin-dive to pick up shells and corals on our free days. Although my future was uncertain at that point, I was carefree and felt at peace. 




Andrew with his shell-craft art on a local newspaper





As a young man at that time, I did what made my heart sing, and got involved in whatever I was interested in, even though at that point I was not sure what I could do for the rest of my life. The pleasant surprises when the glazes turned out pretty after every firing, the countless hours practicing on the wheels, the heartbreaking failures whenever I made mistakes - all turned out to be wonderful memories and they prepared me for the years to come. 




Andrew featured in a local news article





After I graduated from Baharuddin Vocational Institute in 1972, I was conscripted into the army for National Service (NS). Back then, NS was not as structured as it is today because it was quite new. One of the sergeants was my former schoolmate, and he saw that I had design background, so he recommended me to the commanding officer to help out with the interior design of some offices in the camp. In those days when the defence force was just starting out, the conscripts served in different ways, with their talents and skills to improve the standard of our armed forces and the conditions that we train in. My basic military training was pretty unique. I got to skip some military training, except for certain key activities like live firing and physical training sessions, to help out with the interior design and decoration of the camps. Once the basic military training ended, I got posted to the signal school to become a signaller. 
When I got posted to the unit, coincidentally, the clerk there was my former volleyball teammate back in school. He was also the son of the founder of Cathay Photo. Back in school, he was the setter and I was the spiker. He was elated to see me, and told me that I could represent the unit for volleyball competitions. I trained day and night. The finals for the armed forces volleyball competition coincided with the final exam for the signaller course. In the end, I got exempted from the exam and my unit won the 2nd place for the volleyball competition. Our superiors were proud of us and gave us two weeks' off from training. 




Andrew during his army days





After completing the signal course, I was posted to a new signal battalion. There were only 20 odd of us when we got posted there because it was newly set up. The camp was empty, so we had a lot of work to do to build the battalion up from scratch. They saw that I was a sportsman, and since there wasn't enough manpower, I had to represent the battalion in most of the sports like volleyball, swimming and sepak takraw (similar gameplay to volleyball but only with your feet), even though I had no experience. I also got the chance to join the Small Arms Meet (shooting competition among different military units), and I think that was the highlight of my NS journey. I got to practise at the shooting range daily, and sometimes the gun barrel would go red-hot. It was fun, but it was not easy; we had a lot of physical training to ensure that we had the physical strength to stabilise ourselves when we fire. We did pretty well for the battalion in the meet. Looking back, my national service experience was pretty fun and interesting, and I completed my national service obligations in 1974. 
The market then was saturated with interior designers and carpenters, and there I was again, lost as I stared at the blank canvas of my uncertain future..." (to be continued)


About the Project
The Whistling Shophouses series pays tribute to the rapid development of Singapore from a third world country to a thriving metropolis. Andrew lived through the period where shophouses were ubiquitous throughout the country, to modern times when skyscrapers and housing estates stand where they once stood. These shophouse whistles signify a remembrance of an era past glory. Singapore shophouses are icons that reflect our history and heritage. 




Shophouses along the Singapore River. Photo from: Straits Times








Whistling Shophouse








Details of the reward!





Andrew was also inspired by the European architecture when he was traveling in his younger days, so for this campaign, you can choose to get a Chimney house whistle too! 




Chimney House Whistles








Features of the chimney house whistles!





You can back this campaign to get a mixture of both the designs too :) 









About the Potter









Andrew will be handcrafting every single whistle. Andrew Chua is a Singaporean ceramic artist who began practising ceramic arts in 1970s. Since graduation in 1972, Andrew has exhibited his works in numerous art exhibitions both locally and abroad, and had been commissioned to produce ceramic wares for a Kobe restaurant in Singapore.
Originally trained in ceramics at the Baharuddin Vocational Institute, Andrew gradually broadened his expression in clay from the traditional pots and containers to non-functional objects in which the human form features prominently. Andrew finds sculpture more challenging, and it gives him more scope to express himself, in particular with the many different cultural elements in Singapore.
Since 1992, Andrew began making wind instruments and whistles, ranging from adaptations of primitive South American ocarina and Chinese xun, to unique contemporary creations of his own. His more recent creations include meticulously-crafted pendant clay whistles to owl ocarinas. At a time where online tutorials were not available, Andrew's successes with ceramic whistles, ocarinas and other instruments stemmed from his multiple failures and his determination to get it right. Support him by backing this campaign!
Covid-19 hit the artists hard, especially the older ones who are not as tech savvy. Share this campaign with your friends and families to show your support! Thank you!


Budget
The funds from the backers will be used for the clay, glaze and studio firing costs, as well as the material costs for packaging your items :)

description_story:
Story







The Clutch is an essential item that can be used in everyday life. However, having seen so many people carrying clutches of all sizes, we began studying and surveying the users as to what are the specifications they are looking for in a clutch. The traits they are looking for in a Clutch are:MinimalisticStylishUniqueAwesome QualityFunctionalityAfter months of designing, sourcing for suitable materials, matching intrinsic elegant colours and countless product testing, Luxather's Clutch Collection is created!







Created in Singapore for the working professionals, the adventurer, the students and the modern human, Luxather's Clutch Series is designed in two styles: The White Series and The Classic Series!


The White Series








The Classic Series





















Luxather's Clutch is created in the most minimalistic way, with a gorgeous exterior but without the branding. It is designed with elegant colours which are one of a kind! After all, we reached out to many people in the international community for their opinions and these opinions are the reason why Luxather's Clutch Collection is so valuable: It is crafted for the community, by the community. We want to be able to set you up for any occasion, stylishly and effortlessly. Just dress up, arm yourself with the Clutch and off you go, Stunningly!























 Are you all ready to be armed with Luxather's Clutch Collection? One of the most functional and stylish Clutches that is released right now! 









Luxather's Clutch is designed to store your documents and 13inch laptops securely. Magnetism is used as a method of closing the Clutch to secure the clutch's contents, it removes the fuss of having to find the buttons or locking mechanism to close the Clutch.







With the Clutch's ability to expand and compress, this technique makes it less bulky and portable, allowing the user to carry it with ease! Also, being crafted for the everyday user, it can act as a secondary bag to store documents and it fits into most bags that you carry around!Luxather's Clutch is timeless; it is vibrant and will not go out of trend! The Clutch Collection is the best gift you can receive, as well as give. 










The Classic Series "Milk Chocolate"








The Classic Series "Tanned"








The White Series "Tiffany"








The White Series "Santorini"





















On top of the designs we have displayed, you can expect two other models, the Roselia and Navy. You can expect it to be as gorgeous as the collections that have been portrayed!These are the colour-ways for the Clutch Collection where you can choose from in the Post-Campaign survey!For the colour spheres, the sphere on the left is the main colour, the sphere on the right is the interior colour.All our colours are intrinsically matched and will complement you effortlessly.
description_risks:
Our aim of launching on Kickstarter is to share Luxather's Collection and our brand name with the world and to let everyone know that functional and stylish bags need not be expensive. Everyone and anyone should be able to own a clutch in this era!

The most important aim via Kickstarter is to establish ourselves, not to earn marked up profits. Luxather's collections offer value to our backers at the lowest price we can go to cover all the costs mentioned above. Kickstarter Backer's are catalysts to our growth and we are very grateful for it.

Thank you so much for supporting Luxather! You can look forward to our future collections!

We hope you will be able to share our humble and upcoming brand with your friends and families and support our collections!

blurb: Fun-filled and inspiring art book by full-time illustrator Rachta Lin, based on her 2016 artist journey experiences.
description: Fun-filled and inspiring art book by full-time illustrator Rachta Lin, based on her 2016 artist journey experiences.
name: Rachta Lin Artist Journey Art Book
title: Rachta Lin Artist Journey Art Book
Title: Artist Journey of 2016, Rachta Lin
Description: Fun-filled and inspiring art book by full-time illustrator Rachta Lin, based on her 2016 artist journey experiences.
Link: Artist Journey of 2016, Rachta LinFun-filled and inspiring art book by full-time illustrator Rachta Lin, based on her 2016 artist journey experiences.
description_story:
StoryEmbark on the 2016 artist journey with Rachta. The much-requested chronicle, since having left her job to pursue her passion in art full-time, is finally here!Join Rachta Lin as she takes you on a journey as she shares and explains her art, meet new friends and takes part in fun-filled events around the world. With a foreword by renowned artist sakimichan and light-hearted conversations, photos and quotes by friends such as Blizzard girl gamer Tradechat, gamer Gustavo and cosplayer YingTze, this is the art book that's not to be missed!Kickstarter LIVE Video:






 







This is an art book that brings you on Rachta's 2016 artist journey. While the focus is on her experiences, it also includes her fan-favorite illustrations done that year. Rachta shares the decisions behind each featured piece and includes, never seen before, behind-the-scenes discussions and conversations. We hope that Rachta's experiences help to inspire and guide aspiring artists to pursue this career full time while sharing some of the thought processes behind each of her astounding art pieces.The 50 page (approx.) book is exceptionally and lavishly illustrated and designed in full-color. A lot of work and attention has gone into each art piece and in collecting the thoughts and memories of the unforgettable experiences.We are extremely grateful and honored to have sakimichan write the foreword for Rachta's first book. Sakimichan is an outstanding artist of our time and serves as an inspiration for all artists. Her illustrations are truly outstanding and a work of art.This book kickstarts Rachta's yearly series where she chrono-logs her annual experiences of her artist journey.







 







 








 Rachta's fascination with manga and animation got her bit by the geek culture bug early. Since leaving her corporate life behind, this artist, with her traditional & digital art, has been traveling around the world, attending events and meeting fans – proving that the ability to create is within all of us.





You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play


































Replay with sound









Play with 
 sound












00:00


00:00


































 







 







 







 







Supporting Rachta's Kickstarter isn't just about the project. To us, it's a show of trust, support, and encouragement for her passion and what she loves. We are proud to bring you these rewards as a sign of gratitude towards your faith, support, and love.







 








 







 








Wish you can merge two (or more) rewards together? We've heard you and introduced Add-Ons. These extra loot provide you a level of customization for your rewards package. Some are even exclusive and cannot be found in any Backer tier! 







To get them, simply edit your pledge to add in the value of the 'add-on' you want. We will contact you after the Kickstarter campaign completes to confirm which add-on you want. And as always, you'll get to pick the illustration you want! Shipping for add-ons is free! (For example: If you have pledged $70 and want the exclusive SGD19 Large Foil Print, simply add SGD19 to your pledge). 







 







 







 








 





 







Jan – Dec 2016: Creation of over 20 artworks for the art book (Complete!)End Dec 2016 - Mid Jan 2017: Collection of conversation & experiences of featured friends (Complete!)Early Feb 2017: Writing of the book (Complete!)Mid Feb 2017: ISBN book registration (Complete!)Mid - End Feb 2017: Editing of the book (Complete!)Mar 2017: Design of the book (Ongoing)Early Apr 2017: Production file sent to printerMid Apr 2017: Visit printer for 1st round proofsEnd Apr 2017: Start mailing Supporter Rewards for tiers: Supporter Package, Postcard Package, Small Artist Print Package, Large Artist Print PackageMid Apr - Mid May 2017: ProductionJune 2017: Start mailing Supporter Rewards tiers Early Bird Special! and higher, to you!







We have confirmed convention attendance for Doujin Market, FanimeCon and Anime Expo this year. You may choose to collect your rewards (tiers that include art books only) at Rachta’s booth in these conventions. The self-collection rates are much friendlier (as compared to shipping) and already include Kickstarter’s fees and packaging materials. The difference in shipping rates will be refunded when you collect the rewards at the events. Rates and event information are listed in the ‘New & Improved Shipping Rates’ table in the following section. What you will need to collect your rewards at the booth:
Photo ID (Driver’s License, Passport, National ID etc)
Proof of Kickstarter Backing (Screenshot of Kickstarter Backing, Backer’s Email etc)
Note: The rewards will be mailed to you should you miss self-collection at the event. 








We understand the perils of expensive shipping & handling. Thus, product specifications were designed with this in mind, while minimizing the impact to quality. All of Rachta's artist prints are done on high quality and thick 250gsm white card and postcards on 330gsm white cards. The ARTIST JOURNEY OF 2016, RACHTA LIN art book also bears the same detailed thought process behind each product design and will feature similar high-quality materials. Having learned from over ten years of logistic experiences, our shipping & handling is efficient – artist prints are shipped rolled in a postage tube, postcards in a padded envelope etc. All Supporter Rewards are shipped from Singapore via registered mail with tracking.Update: We managed to work with our logistics provider for more efficient shipping to get the rewards into your hands! This means that: 
Most of the rewards are updated with the new & improved shipping rates. Rewards currently pledged (by existing backers) cannot be edited and still show the old rates. However, do not worry as we will refund the difference after the Kickstarter completes. 
If you backed a reward tier before the shipping rate change, you will be refunded the difference after the Kickstarter completes.
The new improved shipping charges are updated in the table below.
Both the original and new shipping charges are shown below for your comparison.








 

 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 







Images are for illustration purposes only. Final product might differ from images shown.

The team has provided production support for over 300 events, of which over 30 are of Rachta's events & appearances. Naturally, all manner of risk cannot be removed. However, we have kept the amount of risk to a minimum with our experience and incorporated buffers for all potential issues that might arise. Nevertheless, we are committed to staying on schedule and communicating any deviations that may occur.

blurb: The world's only reversible all season family tent designed to save the lives of homeless and vulnerable living in extreme weather.
description: The world's only reversible all season family tent designed to save the lives of homeless and vulnerable living in extreme weather.
name: WeatherHYDE: an all season life-saving tent
title: WeatherHYDE: an all season life-saving tent
Title: WeatherHYDE: an all season life-saving tent
Description: The world's only reversible all season family tent designed to save the lives of homeless and vulnerable living in extreme weather.
Link: WeatherHYDE: an all season life-saving tentThe world's only reversible all season family tent designed to save the lives of homeless and vulnerable living in extreme weather.
description_story:
Story







 









 











 











 









 ALL-WEATHER PROTECTIONThe innovative use of a triple layered flysheet makes the weatherHYDE extremely suitable for extreme weather conditions. The reflective layer traps a family's body to heat for warmth, and reflects solar heat for summers.WOMEN-FRIENDLYOur triple layer skin blocks light and doesn't cast embarrassing shadows. The fully enclosed weatherHYDE provides privacy and a safe haven for women, their children and families. URBAN DEPLOYMENT FRIENDLYThe sturdy design allows weatherHYDE to be deployed in tough conditions. We added weight to the frame to eliminate the need for anchoring. Reflective details and bright colors increase urban visibility and night safety.EMPOWERING TO THE HOMELESS THROUGH LOCAL MANUFACTURINGThe simplicity in its manufacturing makes local production possible, creating enterprise and job opportunities for the homeless to help pull them out of their homeless state.







In 2016, billionBricks launched weatherHYDE's first pilot test in Delhi, India, giving homeless individuals like 23-year-old Khushi their first homes.







  







 









 









There are more than 33 million homeless all over the world who have no protection from life-threatening extreme weather conditions. With many unable to survive the harsh winters or summers, the rate of death in certain environments can be as high as 120 persons per hour.Affecting developed and developing nations alike, it impacts millions of homeless who are the most vulnerable to illnesses and diseases caused by exposure to extreme weather. 







 









In 2013, almost 9,000 families were rendered homeless by communal riots in the North Indian town of Muzaffarnagar. In this community alone, more than 30 children died when the night temperatures fell to near freezing. Link to story.







After this incident, billionBricks innovated an emergency tent to protect homeless families from the harsh weather conditions, which the they endure and fight while living on the streets.







 









YOU CAN HELP A HOMELESS INDIVIDUAL OR FAMILYYour pledge can send a WeatherHYDE tent to homeless families in India, or to disaster-displaced families across Asia Pacific.You also have the option of purchasing a WeatherHYDE for someone whom you know is homeless and in need. This option is available for limited countries.GET A WEATHERHYDE OF YOUR OWNBy purchasing one for your own personal use, you would be able to help by allowing us to send more tents to the homeless. Since we do not profit from those purchased for the homeless, we've created a separate package at a higher cost for private use. BUY ONE AND GIVE ONEHelp us reach our funding goal buy buying one for yourself and gifting one to a homeless family in need.







We are shipping WeatherHYDE to the United States, India and Singapore. 







We are committed to be fully transparent  and to keep you informed, especially with details such as where your donated tent will be deployed, details on family beneficiaries - their background and feedback on weatherHYDE use - and ways by which the product is making an impact in their lives.







 









 









 









TOOL-LESS SET UP IN UNDER 15 MINUTES







weatherHYDE's low-tech and simple design enables flexibility and easy deployment. DESIGNED FOR YEAR-ROUND WEATHER CONDITIONS 







The innovative use of mylar makes the weatherHYDE easily adaptable to different seasons and climates. Its reflective layer traps a family's body heat for warmth in the winter, and reflects solar heat to keep temperatures cool during summer.  PRIVACY FOR WOMEN AND CHILDREN









Our triple layer skin blocks light and doesn't cast embarrassing shadows, allowing a fully enclosed weatherHYDE to provide privacy and a safe haven for women, their children and families.ADAPTABLE TO URBAN USE







The sturdy design allows weatherHYDE to be deployed in tough urban conditions. We added weight to the frame to eliminate the need for anchoring, so they can be set up even on pavements. Reflective details and bright colors increase urban visibility and night safety.MULTI-PURPOSE FUNCTIONALITY







Its functionality ensures flexible use and reuse as an emergency shelter, a temporary home, or even a comfortable camping tent. 


 







 All prices listed below are in Singapore Dollars. 








 









 







 







 







 







 







 







 







 









 









 









Focused on delivering a user friendly, durable product, we adapted our design over and over again starting in 2013 with multiple prototy. Finally we can offer you an innovative solution that bridges the gap for weatherproof shelters.







 









 








ASSEMBLED DIMENSIONS1.5m x 1.8m with a maximum height of 1.6m. The minimum inner height is 0.75m. PACKED DIMENSIONS0.75m x 0.35m x 0.35m (without structure); 9kg.









PRODUCT DISCLAIMERS
Frame parts made of UPVC pipes are not included in the package but can be locally purchased anywhere in the world.
Pipe bags are included.


winterHYDE is the former name of weatherHYDE. 


Patent pending.
PILOT TESTEarlier this year, we have tested it with 15 families in New Delhi over a 6 month long pilot project, the results of which have been very positive. 







 









 









We design and provide shelter and infrastructure solutions for the homeless and vulnerable which are scalable, sustainable, and able to create opportunities for communities to emerge out of poverty. We operate two design studios, in Singapore and Mumbai, and create high quality women focussed design solutions for the poorest of communities.Since our founding in 2013, we've impacted more than 1,000 homeless and vulnerable through design and infrastructure projects in South and South Asia. OUR PARTNERS







Do you have any questions for details we haven't covered? Get in touch through our contact page.
description_risks:
Confident in our capacity to deliver, we acknowledge certain risks and challenges which we may encounter, which we want you to be aware of:

MANUFACTURING RISKS
While many problems may arise at this stage, we guarantee the the availability of our design and material components, and the readiness of our experienced manufacturers to handle large orders, and troubleshoot should there ever be a need. 

INTERNATIONAL LOGISTICS AND FULFILLMENT RISKS
Shipment related problems such as with lost or damaged products, customs, and shipment delays due to bad weather and inaccurate shipping information may occur. Further, the speed and price of shipping may vary with the number of units we deliver to each country. 

However, we have built a very capable team and prepared ourselves to the best of our expertise to forecast demand and create a solid supply plan. In rare cases, should any problem arise on your order, we assure you that we will be transparent with you every step of the way, and will try our best to quickly solve the problem.

Title: Chinese Zodiac Medals
Description: Virtual Running Events: Run/walk/jog anytime, anywhere, anyway of your choice.
Link: Chinese Zodiac MedalsVirtual Running Events: Run/walk/jog anytime, anywhere, anyway of your choice.
description_story:
StoryShort Summary
We are Hello Run and we are working on this new startup to provide you with virtual sports events. With the current COVID-19 pandemic going on, we are unable to join race events like how we used to with the joy of completing a distance and receiving a token of effort. Perhaps regardless, you did not have the time to commit to train and attend race events.


Here we are with a solution where you can run/walk/jog when you can. You may even use a treadmill! Our aim is to get people moving any time, anywhere, any way at their own pace and preferences. Upon reaching the goal, submit screenshots of your runs/walks/jogs data and simply wait for your hard earned medal to arrive in your mailbox!


People like being recognised and awarded for their efforts and contribution and we hear you. We want to make runs/walks/jogs rewarding intrinsically when you feel stronger and better about yourselves and extrinsically with medal collection to appraise your effort. And even better! These medals that you earned can be personally engraved with your name too. Who doesn’t like customised items, right? Be recognised and valued for your accomplishments!


To bring across this opportunity and experience, we will need your help and encouragement. From designing, manufacturing to setting up this whole project, we require financial support to execute Hello Run successfully.


What We Need & What You Get

















Visit bottom of page for bigger image size.
(Actual product may differ slightly due to colour and placement of digital copy)


For our first series, we have decided on the 12 Chinese Zodiac animals. We worked with an experienced designer to bring you fashionable medal designs that you can not only collect to show your achievement, but also you can add it as an accessory to your outfits.


Hence this is where we need your support. We have created a few tiers that you can choose from:
1 - Donation - any amount
2 - Any 1 Zodiac @ Early Bird $17, Pre-launch $18, Original $19.90 each
3 - Any 1 Zodiac with Shirt @ Early Bird $31, Pre-launch $33, Original $36.80 each
4 - 12 Zodiac Set + Special Box Packaging @ Early Bird $191, Pre-launch $203, Original $238.80
5 - 12 Zodiac Set + Special Box Packaging with Shirt and free engraving @ Early Bird $205, Pre-launch $217, Original $255.70


Special Limited Shirt includes 1x 12 Zodiac dry fit T-shirt. You may choose the design that you want (we will contact you). See bottom of page for more designs.







  (Actual product may differ slightly due to colour and placement of digital copy)


Currently we are working on the Chinese Zodiac series and it will be released each month corresponding to the order, ie. Rat in January 2021, Ox in February 2021 and so on. Participants may choose to pre-order but the real event will only start in the corresponding months.


However for you, as our early supporter, we will process all orders and ship your medals and merch in approx Feb/March 2021, or earlier. You do not have to wait for the corresponding months to receive your items! We do not expect you to run/walk/jog but you still can if you wish to~


This is how it will work when we officially launch in 2021:

  Visit our website and select the medal you want
  Sign up by making payment
  Finish the race within 15 days, or otherwise stated
  Record your runs/walks/jogs with any mobile app
  Submit your data to our email with screenshots showing the distance and dates (must be within 15 days from date of purchase or else not counted!)
  We will then take 3-5 business working days to check verify and send you a confirmation email before shipping out your medal
  Wait for your well-deserved medal to reach your mailbox!

 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you like our concept, please spread the word, tell your friends and family about us! Every support counts and we are thankful to you for doing so.
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hellorun.org
Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/hellorun_org
If you have any enquiries, you may contact us at support@hellorun.org


List of Designs 
(Actual product may differ slightly due to colour and placement of digital copy)


Rat 

























 Ox

























Tiger 

























Rabbit

























Dragon 

























 Snake 

























Horse

























 Goat

























Monkey 

























Rooster

























Dog

























Pig
description_risks:
Costs: Based on our initial calculations and the current Chinese Zodiac designs, we will require at least a sum of SGD 7,500 but with more funding, we will be able to provide more stocks and medal designs in the future. In order to make the medals, we will need to create molds and then the medal itself. This comes to around SGD 3,000 for the molds and test quantity of each design. Incorporation and setting up the website itself comes to over SGD 2,000. Another SGD 1,500 or so will be needed to cover the machinery and designs, thus reaching the minimum sum required. The remaining SGD 1,000 of the goal will go to this platform.

Design: Getting the right design that can appeal to people. We understand that design is something that is personal. Something that appeals to us may not be appealing to certain groups of people. Hence we hope to come up with ideas and concepts that can attract as many people as possible.

Timeline: As we are aiming to launch everything by 2021 in time for January’s Rat medal, we are working tight to make sure we have all the necessary tools and platforms to execute this. Then we will have other festivals, holidays and events to prepare for as well.

blurb: Become a Level Designer & design the toughest dungeon crawler - But you must lead a party through that very same level and survive it!
description: Become a Level Designer & design the toughest dungeon crawler - But you must lead a party through that very same level and survive it!
name: Black Souls 2.0 - Cheaper. Better. More.
title: Black Souls 2.0 - Cheaper. Better. More.
Title: Black Souls: The Game
Description: Become a Level Designer & design the toughest dungeon crawler - But you must lead a party through that very same level and survive it!
Link: Black Souls: The GameBecome a Level Designer & design the toughest dungeon crawler - But you must lead a party through that very same level and survive it!
description_story:
Story





Our heartfelt gratitude to all our backers for your strong support of Black Souls! Thanks to you, this game will be MADE! If you have missed this campaign, we can still try to help you in some way or other. Drop us an email at: Sales@MedievaLords.com





FREE MINI-EXPANSION FOR ALL SETS!We are into our final lap now! Whether or not this really fun and unique game becomes a reality depends on the next 24 hours! We have added nice promos for Castle Dukes & Queen of the Hill. We have added cool crossover Black Souls tiles from The Networks Executives. We have added a really nice special boss tile featuring the Castle Dukes dragon as a boss here in Black Souls. We have added very cool extra Scoring Boards to the game for all 6 players. We have made an awesome AI for Solo Mode. We are adding 1 extra die to the game for Solo Mode too. Still we are short by that really small amount! To push things further, we are now throwing in something MORE again! We will produce the mini-expansion and include it into all your sets for no additional cost - yes, FREE!







SOLO MODE AI:Dominic has made a Solo Mode video to show how the AI works! Here is the video: (The video uses the prototype we have, which is still using non-colorblind friendly components and not yet implemented with inclusivity - the final product WILL be otherwise.)


Enjoy!Designer Inc's latest video game title Black Souls has achieved international success! Hailed as one of the toughest digital games ever, it has attracted millions of hardcore gamers. The secret behind this huge success lies not in just making an extremely difficult game. Anyone can do that. The true challenge lies in balancing it to be as difficult as possible, but still fair enough that the very best players can survive to the end. Alas, the game studio is heavily short staffed and the management is looking to hire one more Game Designer for developing more content in Black Souls.







You have been given a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be hired by Designer Inc as a level designer, an integral part of Black Souls' development team! As one of the finalist candidates, you must prove your designing skills under the judging eyes of your future employers in an 'Early Beta Access' trial to create a level that best reflects the spirit of Black Souls - a very difficult, yet fair game. A group of professional playtesters will be sent to try out your carefully designed level, and provide feedback on whether they like or dislike it. If the level is too easy, they would not feel challenged at all. If it is too hard, they would all be killed and find it unfair. Who will be the final candidate to be inducted into the ranks of Designer Inc?


As the campaign progresses, more content may be unlocked in addition to the above chart due to Stretch Goals.





 







ALL Kickstarter copies of Black Souls will have every single promo featured above for free. These are on top of any stretch goals unlocked during the campaign itself.






 







In Black Souls, players are candidates vying for the dream job of being a Game Designer on an internationally successful video game. They must design a beta level for the game, balancing difficulty with good matrix. First, they will design their own dungeon crawler levels. Then they will lead a professional team of playtesters through the very levels they just designed. Whether the playtesters like the design or not, depends on how challenging the levels are, as well as if at least one survives the level.

The game is played in 2 phases - Design phase, followed by Gameplay phase. During the Design phase, players will play Bid Cards simultaneously to snatch first pick on their tile of choice from a common pool.







Note that Bid Cards also have special abilities that help the players in some way. It is important to play these abilities at the right time, advancing the players in their strategies.

Once each player has a tile, they immediately place the tile onto their own individual Design Board. Tiles can be placed on any of 3 levels, but must always fill the leftmost space if it is on either level 1 or 3, and must always fill the rightmost space if it is on level 2.







If players' Bid Cards clash, they go last regardless of their numbers played. Also, their powers do not trigger. However, each player has 2 Hacks which allows them to ignore this penalty.







 Once all players have completed their level designs with 12 tiles each, phase 2 occurs and players take on the roles of the professional playtesters sent to test their levels.







On each tile, the party must clear the location by resolving ONE type of hero to die. In the example shown, the party will clear the current tile location by killing just 1 Fighter, or 2 Mages, or 3 Healers. The last value on the tile is the Difficulty rating of the tile and is only used for end-game scoring.







This video was made to teach you a quick overview of Black Souls in just 2 and a half minutes:


 Download the Rule Book HERE! (This is NOT final - There are some changes pending!)
The following video is a full playthrough of Black Souls by the Pink Meeple folks. Who do you think got the job in the end?


 







The following reviews were all made with prototype parts and components. The final game WILL be different (for the better, of course!)







The ultimate test!! We took the game for a wild spin with complete strangers in public at GenCon 50! Check out their unscripted feedback~


 And yes, we were one of the featured games on BGG's Live Videos at GenCon50!!







 Here's the full video feature from the BGG team!


 









 As mentioned on Dice Tower's News at HERE (CLICK)









 REVIEW PENDING - STAY TUNED!







"The game’s theme is very unique - That each player can program their own “game” and then run characters through it!" -Jamey, Stonemaier Games, specifically on just the theme of the game.







"The drafting is really clever, the scoring is really clever, the setting is really clever… it’s just clever up and down the street!" -Richard Ham, Rahdo Runs ThruRahdo Playthrough Video:


 Rahdo Extended Playthrough:


 Rahdo's Final Thoughts:


 









"Black Souls is a fun little "meta-game" for the would-be video game designer in all of us." -David Waybright, Man VS Meeple


 









 


"Black Souls is very easy to pick up because of its simple, clean rules. Then you get into a game of it and realize the choices are very interesting!" -Forrest Bower, BGC


 









The following are the tiers available for the duration of this Kickstarter campaign. Note that the Retailer Pledge tier is NOT available to the general public. Stringent checks will be made to ensure we protect our retailer partners. PLEASE REMEMBER THAT THIS CAMPAIGN IS IN SGD CURRENCY - WHICH IS A LOT LOWER IN VALUE THAN USD!







 







Simply add any of the following items to your pledge rewards by paying the appropriate fees as stated. For example, if you wanted to add a copy of Sweet Spot, just add another $42SGD on top of your pledge tier amount. We will send out a survey at the end of the campaign to check with each individual backer on what their additional money is intended for.







  







We are always looking to work with our retailer partners as much as possible. If you are a retailer, we have specially made a pledge tier just for you! Please check out the "Retailer Pledge" tier on the right. Do note that this is strictly for brick and mortar retailers, and we will require proof of business license as well. If you have any further questions regarding retailer support, reach out to us via email at Sales@MedievaLords.com







Black Souls will be charging shipping straight off from the campaign itself. There will be no additional cost after the campaign to watch out for - unless you are getting add-ons of Castle Dukes. Thanks to Quartermaster Logistics, we have managed to get affordable shipping! They do not handle the Asia+Australia regions though, so the rates for these places are not going to change too much. We did have a long internal meeting, and decided we wanted everyone to be happy still. So we will also reduce the shipping by just that tiny little bit through our own pockets for folks in these places.For this relaunch, we also managed to find a way to give great savings on combined shipping, so get a few buddies and pool them together! The minimum for the savings of combined shipping is 3 copies though.Lastly for Singapore only, we have the luxury of having our headquarters here, so we can allow local pick-up at the Battle Bunker retail shop. If you are fine with doing self-collection at Battle Bunker, there is a special tier just for Singaporeans to do so, and this will then bring your shipping down to as low as what the US backers are enjoying - which is about US$9. There is STILL shipping charge, because we are shipping the games in from China, and they are not manufactured locally.







Battle Bunker Productions:







Medieval Lords will officially be working under the banner of Battle Bunker Productions for this game. The same folks from Medieval Lords that you have come to trust over the multiple Kickstarters will all still be on the team, but with more firepower now that we are part of the Battle Bunker family. Medieval Lords has upheld a strong reputation despite its smaller following simply because we do right by our backers, and we have a track record of delivering our previous KS campaigns EARLY! That's something to boast about!







The Game Design Corner:As always, following in the tradition of Medieval Lords, we will share the game matrix of Black Souls for the hardcore players who are interested in looking at the balance of the game.Click HERE to download the game data for Black Souls!

If you have been an ardent supporter of Medieval Lords, you will know we put maximum respect to all our backers and attempt to go every mile for everyone of you. At a 6 to 7 months timeline, we are already providing a very, very short production timeline compared to more than half of other Kickstarter tabletop games out there. On top of that, we have been delivering EARLY across all our previous Kickstarters :)

Description: Unlock ZERO-WAIT Instant Water Purification in a Reusable Straw - and it's filterless!
Link: LUMISTRAW | Instant Water Purification now Simple as a SipUnlock ZERO-WAIT Instant Water Purification in a Reusable Straw - and it's filterless!
description_story:
Story















Meet LUMISTRAW | Instant Water Purification is now Simple as a Sip - and it's magically filterless









LUMISTRAW uses state of the art purify-as-you-drink technology to give you instantly clean water, all with the convenience of a reusable straw.
Instead of waiting for your water to boil, going through the hassle of changing filters, using water purifying tablets or dealing with outdated disinfection technology, LUMISTRAW taps on Champs Industrial’s LUMIFLO Technology (patent-pending), enabling you to quench your thirst and drink clean water wherever you want it, whenever you want it.









Water purification is long in need of an update. 
We at Champs Industrial have been designing consumer household water products for more than 20 years. In our years in the business, we have understood that water is the essence of life, yet getting clean water is riddled with inconveniences.
With current systems, we are constantly troubled with paying monthly subscriptions of time, effort and memory for the maintenance of our filter systems. 









Even with the latest light-based purification bottles, we are made to wait 60 seconds before we can even consider drinking.  









The Big Realisation
This is when we realised, 
Why should we purify large vessels of water just to wait endlessly for a sip of clean water? 









What if you could purify only what you want to drink as you’re drinking it?

















LUMISTRAW uses state of the art purify-as-you-drink technology to give you instantly clean water, all with the convenience of a reusable straw.
 LUMISTRAW Features 









Instantly Purified Water
Utilising our patent-pending purify-as-you-drink technology, LUMISTRAW reinvents the way we use UV-C to bring down the time you wait for your water to virtually nothing.
Effortless Purification 









Just press and drink. No opening of bottles, no waiting, no nothing, just drink.
Replace Nothing, Ever Again









Never replace another filter, bottle or anything ever again. Just press and drink.
Purify Without Limits 









Based off medical grade UV-C Technology, LUMISTRAW allows you to purify water endlessly, and we mean ENDLESSLY.
Drink Anytime, Anywhere 









LUMISTRAW is made to be portable to carry along wherever you may go, making clean drinking water a convenience you never knew you missed.
Drink the Way You Like It









Drink from a cup, a bottle, a pool (ok maybe not the pool), whatever you like. LUMISTRAW isn't limited by a vessel.  


Anti-Spill. Anti-Leak. Anti-Worry









With the inclusion of a one way valve, never worry about water messing with your life.









































 Process 







 LUMISTRAW's Purifying Capabilities






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play


































Replay with sound









Play with 
 sound












00:00


00:00


































 The LUMISTRAW Team 









Water safety has been our priority over the past 20 years. As water heater specialists, we now bring this experience to water purification. Blending the latest technological innovations with seamless user experience, we aim to provide safe drinking water to everyone.
We are committed to adhering to stringent quality control procedures and practices, as well as engagements with scientists in research collaborations, to provide customers product solutions with high standards of hygiene. 









To bring you a truly ergonomic product, we collaborated with award-winning agency STUCK to create a truly beautiful product that fits perfectly into your life.

































This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 950+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $400M raised between them.

We do share the same risk that all kickstarter projects share when going into large scale manufacturing. There will be some fine edits so that we can create a more easily reproducible product. Nevertheless, we are working with a strong set of engineers to ensure that any changes to the design during manufacturing will be minimal and will not change the experience we plan to bring you with LUMISTRAW.
